comment.author: 37908896@N00
comment._content: Bill Stumpf (b. 1892 - d. 1966) had a short career in the majors of roughly one year (May 11, 1912 - May 21, 1913), all with the Highlanders/Yankees.  Interestingly, during that time, he played at every infield position (1B, 2B, SS, 3B), as well as playing at least two games in the outfield.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you for your information. We will update the source data and reload the description.
